title.en: Introduction to Fourier Optics and Imaging

faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The lectures and computational lab sessions will cover the necessary engineering aspects for designing an imaging system and analyze its characteristics in spatial and spectral coordinates.
description.et: Loengud ja laboripraktikumid hõlmavad pilditöötlussüsteemi projekteerimiseks vajalikke tehnilisi aspekte ning omaduste analüüsi ruumiliste - ja spektraalkoordinaatide põhjal.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to introduce the fundamentals of imaging, linear optical systems and Fourier analysis of imaging systems.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on tutvustada pildinduse põhialuseid, lineaaroptilisi süsteeme ja Fourier' analüüsi kasutamist pildindussüsteemides.

learning_outcomes.en: At the end of the course, the student understands
*	Principles of geometrical optics for the design of imaging systems.
*	Basic concepts of imaging and characteristics of linear optical systems.
learning_outcomes.et: · Pildinduse põhimõistetest ja lineaarsete optiliste süsteemide omadustest

learning_outcomes.en: *	Spatial analysis of coherent imaging systems.
*	Spectral analysis of coherent imaging systems.
At the end of the course, the student gains essential skillsets on
*	Design of simple imaging systems, analyze the characteristics and reverse engineer them.
learning_outcomes.et: · Lihtsate pildindussüsteemide projekteerimiseks, nende omaduste analüüsimiseks ja süsteemide pöördprojekteerimiseks

learning_outcomes.en: *	Simulation of imaging systems using MATLAB.

grade_evaluation.et:
Computational lab MATLAB training - 10 points
Computational lab homework - 20 points
Seminars on published work - 20 points
Project work - 20 points
Problem solving and Computational MATLAB exam  - 30 points

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
